fig.label: Figure 1
fig.sd-panel: (A) Animal protocol.

(B) Serum CRAMP determination by ELISA (n = 8). Data information: Data in B were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by unpaired two-tailed t-test for comparison of two groups
(C, D) Western blot of pro-form CRAMP and mature peptide in duodenum and ex vivo duodenal epithelial cells. Data information: Data were representative from three independent experiments.

(E) Localization and expression of CRAMP (red), E-cadherin (green), F4/80 (green) and Ly6G (green) in duodenum by immunofluorescent staining. Representative photomicrographs of individual and merged staining were shown. Nuclei were stained with DAPI (blue). Scale bar: 50 μm. Data information: Data were representative from three independent experiments.

fig.label: Figure 2
fig.sd-panel: (A) Animal protocol.
(B) Changes in body weight relative to starting weight during 6 weeks (n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments.

(C) Left, representative images of duodenal damage by H&E staining. Scale bar: 200 μm. Right, graph depicted the ratio of the morphometric assessment of villus height to crypt depth (n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons..

(D) Western blot and densitometry analyses of duodenal tight junction proteins (claudin-1, occludin, ZO-1 and ZO-2; n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons..

(E) Western blot and densitometry analysis of duodenal zonulin (n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons..

(F) Intestinal permeability was assessed by measuring FITC-dextran (n = 6).
Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons..

fig.label: Figure 3
fig.sd-panel: (A) Animal protocol.

(B) Duodenal CRAMP determination by ELISA (n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.
(C) Changes in body weight relative to starting weight during 6 weeks (n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments.

(D) Left, representative images of duodenal damage by H&E staining. Scale bar: 200 μm. Right, graph depicted the ratio of the morphometric assessment of villus height to crypt depth (n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

(E) Western blot and densitometry analyses of duodenal tight junction proteins (claudin-1, occludin, ZO-1 and ZO-2; n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

(F) Western blot and densitometry analysis of duodenal zonulin (n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

(G) Intestinal permeability was assessed by measuring FITC-dextran (n = 6).
Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

fig.label: Figure 4
fig.sd-panel: (A) Western blot and densitometry analyses of gliadin-triggered inflammatory signaling [p-EGFR (Tyr1068), p-Akt, Akt, MyD88, TRAF6, p-p65 and p65] in epithelial cells ex vivo (n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

(B) Western blot and densitometry analyses of gliadin-triggered inflammatory signaling [p-EGFR (Tyr1068), p-Akt, Akt, MyD88, TRAF6, p-p65, p65 and zonulin] in vitro (n = 6).
Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

fig.label: Figure 5
fig.sd-panel: (A) Il15 expression in duodenal epithelial cells ex vivo (n = 8). Data information: Data in A were representative and were the mean ± SD from two independent experiments.

(B) The frequency of NKG2D+ IELs among CD3+CD4+ population (n = 8). Data information: Data were representative and were the median ± interquartile range from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

(C) The frequency of CX3CR1+ macrophages in CD45+CD11b+ population and ALDH activity in CD45+CD11b+CX3CR1+ macrophages in lamina propria (n = 8). Data information: Data were representative and were the median ± interquartile range from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

(D) The percentages of three subsets of CD45+CD11c+ DCs and ALDH activity in CD45+CD11c+ DCs in lamina propria (n = 8). Data information: Data were representative and were the median ± interquartile range from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

(E-G) The percentages of (E) Foxp3+ Treg, (F) T-bet+ Th1 and (G) RORγt+ Th17 among CD3+CD4+ population in lamina propria were shown by flow cytometry (n = 8).
Data information: Data were representative and were the median ± interquartile range from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

fig.label: Figure 6
fig.sd-panel: (A) The unweighted (left) and weighted (right) UniFrac distances based on OTU abundance (NC: gluten-free, M: gluten; n = 6).
(B) The taxonomic composition distribution at phylum level (n = 6). Data information: P values were calculated by unpaired two-tailed t-test for comparison of two groups
(C) The taxonomic composition distribution at genus level (n = 6). Data information: P values were calculated by unpaired two-tailed t-test for comparison of two groups

(D) Duodenal colonizing P. aeruginosa and A. muciniphila as determined by RT-qPCR using bacterial-specific species gene primers (n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by unpaired two-tailed t-test for comparison of two groups

(E) The production of LasB (a protease of P. aeruginosa) was examined in duodenum (n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by unpaired two-tailed t-test for comparison of two groups

(F) Dot plot of Pearson correlation coefficients among CRAMP, P. aeruginosa and A. muciniphila at species level. The size of each point represented the correlation coefficient and the color represented positive (red) or negative (purple) relationship (n = 6).
(G) Animal protocol.

(H) Duodenal colonizing PA14 and PAO1 as determined by RT-qPCR using P. aeruginosa-specific species gene primer (n = 9). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons

(I) Western blot and densitometry analyses of pro-form CRAMP and mature peptide in duodenum (n = 8).
Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons

fig.label: Figure 7
fig.sd-panel: (A) Animal protocol.

(B) The levels of CRAMP in serum (n = 8). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

(C) The levels of CRAMP in duodenum (n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

(D) Representative images of intestinal damage by H&E staining. Scale bar: 200 μm. The graph depicted the ratio of the morphometric assessment of villus height to crypt depth (n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

(E) Western blot and densitometry analyses of tight junction proteins (claudin-1 and occludin) and zonulin in duodenum (n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

(F) Intestinal permeability was assessed by measuring FITC-dextran (n = 6). Data information: Data were representative and were the mean ± SD from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

(G) The frequency of NKG2D+ IELs among CD3+CD4+ population (n = 8). Data information: Data were representative and were the median ± interquartile range from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

(H) The frequency of CX3CR1+ macrophages among CD45+CD11b+ population (n = 8). Data information: Data were representative and were the median ± interquartile range from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.

(I) The percentages of three subsets of CD45+CD11c+ DCs (n = 8).
(J-L) The percentages of (J) Foxp3+ Treg, (K) T-bet+ Th1 and (L) RORγt+ Th17 among CD3+CD4+ population in lamina propria were shown by flow cytometry (n = 8).
Data information: Data were representative and were the median ± interquartile range from three independent experiments. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post hoc test for multiple comparisons.
